dimensions.notes: 14 = diameter in mm, 43 = height in mm, 0 = cylindrical

protection.unprotected: No built-in protection - requires external BMS

safety_notes: Use appropriate Li-ion charger with CC/CV profile
Avoid physical damage - can cause thermal runaway
Store at 40-60% charge for long term
Unprotected cells require external battery management
Smaller size increases heat concentration risk

chemistry_variants.lco: Lithium Cobalt Oxide - Higher energy density, less stable
chemistry_variants.imr: Lithium Manganese (safer chemistry) - Better thermal stability

comparison_to_similar.vs_aa_nimh: Higher voltage (3.7V vs 1.2V), similar diameter, shorter length
comparison_to_similar.vs_16340: Smaller diameter (14mm vs 16mm), similar capacity range

capacity_vs_discharge.notes: Smaller size limits heat dissipation, affecting high-drain performance

market_notes.applications: Niche applications requiring compact size with moderate power

notes: Compact lithium-ion cell roughly 2/3 the length of a 14500 (AA-sized) battery. Popular in applications where space is extremely limited but AA batteries don't provide sufficient voltage. Less common than other formats, so availability and quality can vary significantly between manufacturers.

sources.name: Battery University - Small Lithium Ion Cells
